cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven where good deities and Celestials dwell; and an Underworld where evil deities and Fiends reside

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Feywild
planes.philosophicalEssence: A land of soft lights and wonder, a place of music and magic. The plane responds to unfettered emotion.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The plane responds to unfettered emotion: flowers turn and tremble in the presence of a heated argument, grass withers under the feet of one who seethes with malice, and birds chirp merrily in the presence of those who are joyous and squawk angrily at those who are dour.

physicalProperties.shape: Parallel dimension occupying the same cosmological space as the Material Plane
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: Breathable atmosphere similar to the Material Plane but with more vibrant and magical qualities.

temperature.description: Variable, depends on the Domain of Delight and the emotional state of the ruling archfey. Some domains are bathed in perpetual sunlight (warm) while others are cast in unending twilight (cooler).

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Variable and responsive to emotion and archfey control. Landscapes are mutable and change frequently.

warpTable.effectDescription: Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to only minutes passing on other planes.
Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to hours passing on other planes.
Time passes normally relative to other planes.
Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to weeks passing on other planes.
Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to months passing on other planes.
Each day spent in the Feywild corresponds to years passing on other planes.

timeFlow.description: Time and distance in the Feywild are mutable. Characters who spend at least 1 day on the Feywild and then leave may find that less or more time has elapsed everywhere else in the multiverse. The DM can choose a time change or roll on the Feywild Time Warp table (d20). A Wish spell can remove the effect on up to ten creatures.

environmentalEffects.name: Memory Loss
environmentalEffects.description: A creature that leaves the Feywild makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. Fey creatures automatically succeed on the saving throw, as do creatures that have the Fey Ancestry trait, such as elves. On a failed save, the creature remembers nothing from its time spent in the Feywild. On a successful save, the creature's memories remain intact but are a little hazy. Any spell that can end a curse can restore the creature's lost memories.
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: On a failed DC 10 Wisdom saving throw when leaving the Feywild, the creature remembers nothing from its time spent in the Feywild. On a success, memories remain intact but hazy.

savingThrow.triggerDescription: When a creature leaves the Feywild

onFailure.description: The creature remembers nothing from its time spent in the Feywild.

onSuccess.description: The creature's memories remain intact but are a little hazy.

recoveryMethods: Any spell that can end a curse

environmentalEffects.emotionalEffect: Loss of all memories from time in the Feywild, or hazy memories on success.
removalMethods: Any spell that can end a curse

environmentalEffects.name: Time Warp
environmentalEffects.description: While time seems to pass normally in the Feywild, characters might spend a day there and realize, upon leaving the plane, that less or more time has elapsed everywhere else in the multiverse. Whenever a creature or group of creatures leaves the Feywild after spending at least 1 day on that plane, the DM can choose a time change or roll on the Feywild Time Warp table (d20).
environmentalEffects.mechanicalEffect: Upon leaving the Feywild after spending at least 1 day, DM rolls d20 on the Feywild Time Warp table: 1-2 days become minutes, 3-6 days become hours, 7-13 no change, 14-17 days become weeks, 18-19 days become months, 20 days become years. A Wish spell can remove the effect on up to ten creatures. Some powerful Fey can grant such wishes if beneficiaries agree to a Geas spell and complete a quest.
removalMethods: Wish spell (removes effect on up to ten creatures)
Powerful Fey granting a wish (requires agreeing to Geas spell and completing a quest)

portals.name: Fey Crossings
portals.destination: Feywild location mirroring the Material Plane location

requirement.description: Fey crossings open infrequently. A crossing might open only during a full moon, on the dawn of a particular day, or for someone carrying a certain type of item. A fey crossing can be closed permanently if the land on either side is dramatically altered—for example, if a castle is built over the clearing on the Material Plane.
requirement.situationCondition: Varies: full moon, specific day at dawn, carrying a certain type of item, or other conditions

portals.colorOrAppearance: Places of mystery and beauty on the Material Plane that have a near-perfect mirror in the Feywild. A traveler passes through by entering a clearing, wading into a pool, passing into a circle of mushrooms, or crawling under the trunk of a tree.

notableEntities.name: Queen Titania
notableEntities.title: Ruler of the Summer Court
notableEntities.description: Archfey who rules the Summer Court, the most settled and pastoral domain in the Feywild. Wrapped in the warmth of a perpetual summer day.

notableEntities.name: Queen of Air and Darkness
notableEntities.title: Ruler of the Gloaming Court
notableEntities.description: Archfey who rules the Gloaming Court, a realm of twilight, fireflies, cobwebs, and autumn leaves.

notableEntities.name: Zybilna
notableEntities.title: Archfey of Prismeer
notableEntities.description: Archfey who rules Prismeer. On some worlds regarded as a fairy godmother of sorts, granting wishes for the lost, the forsaken, or the betrayed. Sometimes her wishes bring happiness, other times despair.

notableEntities.name: Yarnspinner
notableEntities.title: Ruler of Fablerise
notableEntities.description: A story-spinning spider archfey who rules Fablerise. Loves reading stories to the animals that occupy his domain.

specialRules.name: Mutable Geography
specialRules.description: Time and distance in the Feywild are mutable, as is the plane's geography. Roads are uncommon, and the ones that exist change as frequently as the land around themselves. Feywild natives are accustomed to the plane's mutability, but it can be terribly disorienting to visitors.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: The plane's geography, roads, and distances are mutable and change frequently. This can be disorienting to non-native visitors.

specialRules.name: Emotional Responsiveness
specialRules.description: The Feywild responds to unfettered emotion: flowers turn and tremble in the presence of a heated argument, grass withers under the feet of one who seethes with malice, and birds chirp merrily in the presence of those who are joyous and squawk angrily at those who are dour.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: The plane physically responds to the emotions of creatures present. The landscape changes in response to emotional states.

specialRules.name: Domains of Delight - Archfey Governance
specialRules.description: Much of the Feywild is governed by powerful Fey called archfey. The area under a particular archfey's command is called a Domain of Delight and reflects the character and desires of its ruler. Some domains are bright and cheery, bathed in perpetual sunlight and awash in colorful wildflowers, while others are gloomy and drab, cast in unending twilight. Most of them change with the emotional state of their rulers.
specialRules.mechanicalEffect: Each Domain of Delight reflects its archfey ruler's character, desires, and emotional state. The domain's environment—including light level, flora, and atmosphere—changes dynamically based on the ruling archfey's emotional state.

domainsOrRegions.name: Fablerise

ruler.name: Yarnspinner
ruler.title: Story-spinning Spider Archfey
ruler.description: A story-spinning spider archfey who loves reading stories to the animals that occupy his domain.

domainsOrRegions.description: A rambling thicket of twisted roots, thorny vines, and sinuous creepers. This vegetation weaves together to form long tunnels, grand hallways, and enormous domes. Yarnspinner loves reading stories to the animals that occupy his domain.

domainsOrRegions.name: Gloaming Court

ruler.name: Queen of Air and Darkness
ruler.title: Queen of Air and Darkness
ruler.description: Ruler of the Gloaming Court. The Fey of the Gloaming Court shun the formalized etiquette and rituals of the Summer Court, instead prizing behavior that is intuitive and instinctual.

domainsOrRegions.description: A realm of twilight, fireflies, cobwebs, and autumn leaves accompanied by the music of hooting owls and croaking frogs. The Fey of the Gloaming Court shun the formalized etiquette and rituals of the Summer Court, instead prizing behavior that is intuitive and instinctual.

domainsOrRegions.name: Prismeer

ruler.name: Zybilna
ruler.title: Archfey of Prismeer
ruler.description: On some worlds, Zybilna is regarded as a fairy godmother of sorts, granting wishes for the lost, the forsaken, or the betrayed. Sometimes her wishes bring happiness, other times despair.

domainsOrRegions.description: A large domain belonging to the archfey Zybilna. It encompasses a vast swamp called Hither; an ancient forest named Thither; and a stormy, mountainous landscape called Yon. Zybilna resides in the Palace of Heart's Desire, situated where the three portions of her realm meet. The palace is fabled as a destination for anyone seeking their heart's desire.

domainsOrRegions.name: Summer Court

ruler.name: Queen Titania
ruler.title: Archfey Queen of the Summer Court
ruler.description: Ruler of the Summer Court, the most settled and pastoral domain in the Feywild.

domainsOrRegions.description: The most settled and pastoral domain in the Feywild. Wrapped in the warmth of a perpetual summer day, with fluttering butterflies and a riot of colorful flowers, the lands of the Summer Court mimic the trappings of courtly life in some realms of the Material Plane. The residents of this court wear elegant clothing and value elaborate ceremony and ritualized etiquette, and the Fey are quick to shun those who flout the Summer Court's baroque rules.

adventureThemes: Emotional metaphor and physical expression of powerful emotion
Kidnapping and spiriting away to the Feywild
Mischievous Fey stealing abstract concepts (laughter, memories, regrets)
Navigating mutable geography and capricious archfey

adventureSituations.situation: People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.

crossReferences.description: Prismeer, a Domain of Delight belonging to the archfey Zybilna, is detailed in this adventure.
Referenced for Domains of Dread on the Shadowfell, the dark counterpart to Domains of Delight on the Feywild.

planarTravelMethods.name: Fey Crossings
planarTravelMethods.description: Fey crossings are places of mystery and beauty on the Material Plane that have a near-perfect mirror in the Feywild, creating a portal where the two planes touch. A traveler passes through a fey crossing by entering a clearing, wading into a pool, passing into a circle of mushrooms, or crawling under the trunk of a tree. To the traveler, it seems like simply moving into the Feywild. To an observer, the traveler is there one moment and gone the next.
requirements: Finding a location where the Material Plane and Feywild closely mirror each other
Meeting the crossing's opening condition (full moon, specific day, carrying a certain item, etc.)
risks: Time Warp upon leaving the Feywild (d20 table)
Memory Loss upon leaving the Feywild (DC 10 Wisdom saving throw)
Becoming lost in mutable Feywild geography

planarTravelMethods.name: Plane Shift
planarTravelMethods.description: The Plane Shift spell can directly transport adventurers to the Feywild or any other plane of existence.

planarTravelMethods.name: Gate
planarTravelMethods.description: The Gate spell can directly transport adventurers to the Feywild or any other plane of existence with high precision.

planarAdventureSituations.situation: People who venture into the woods keep accidentally wandering into the Feywild or the Shadowfell. They might never return, return with no sense of how much time has passed, or return dramatically changed.
